column1: I tried ballet, but I never got the pointe.
column3: In ballet, a pointe is a technique of dance in which dancers perform on the extreme tip of the toes.
column4: The ballet dancer practiced for years to achieve the perfect pointe.
column5: The artists painting did not have the right pointe, making it difficult to understand.

column1: What do you call a pessimistic antelope? a cantaloupe.
column3: A cantaloupe is a type of fruit.
column4: The cantaloupe was ripe and ready to be eaten at the picnic.
column5: The cantaloupe was so large that it took both hands to carry it.

column1: What do you call a hot pepper with nothing inside it? a hollowpeno.
column3: Hollow can describe an object with an empty interior.
column4: The tree was hollow, providing shelter for small animals.
column5: His explanation felt hollow, lacking any real substance or sincerity.

column1: Why didn’t the blind woman fall into the well? Because she couldn’t see that well.
column3: Well can refer to a deep hole from which water is drawn.
column4: They dug a well in the garden to supply water for the plants.
column5: She didn’t feel well after eating too much candy.
